title: Bernardo Bertolucci - La Luna - (1979)
description:
<a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0079495/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0079495/</a>

This is a Chinese DVD9 with excellent video. Though I don't have anything to compare it with, it looks like all that was changed was the addition of Chinese subtitles.

Sex, Drugs, and Mom.  Need I say more?

Yes, there is an Interview with Bernardo Bertolucci as well as Jean Narboni, a critic and editor of Cahiers de Cinema.  These are in French with no subtitles.

There are brief moments of Italian dialog with no English subtitles. I don't remember my original cinema experience, but it's pretty simple to follow the story without subtitles for these parts.

Roberto Benigni has a very brief comedic part as a curtain hanger. Fred Gwynne in a short appearance as a very un-Munster like father.

Uncompressed Widescreen PAL VIDEO_TS files

Pretty unlikely to find a better DVD quality version of this with Subtitles. Don't know why, but could be the theme that makes this less than appetizing for American and British DVD distributors.
